page.title: 16Block D7(cont)
page.content: ...as{"Y Syrthfa"}(the DEPRESSION).The depression was caused in 1852 when,as a result of sudden flooding,a small colliery was drowned_an event commemorated on a plaque in{Caersalem {Chapel}. The Burry Port Gwendraeth Valley Railway runs through the area of{D7. } It was opened in 1825.At one time the railway provided a convenient means of transport for passengers travelling along the valley to{Cydweli (Kidwelly) and Burry Port on Carmarthen Bay.It is now used only for the transport of coal.
